alert.note: Alert for Eastern Putnam; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 6:47PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central St. Johns, north central Putnam and east central Clay Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 646 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Guana River State Park to near Picolata to near Middleburg. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saint Augustine, Green Cove Springs, World Golf Village, Saint Augustine Beach, Nocatee, Durbin, Vilano Beach, Picolata, South Ponte Vedra and Saint Augustine Shores. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. For boaters on or near the St Johns River or Intracoastal waterway, move to a safe shelter now! Do not be caught on or near the water. Gusty winds and choppy waves are likely. Make sure all on board are wearing life jackets. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern Florida.
